Package net.randombit.botan.spec

Class AeadParameterSpec

java.lang.Object
net.randombit.botan.spec.AeadParameterSpec
All Implemented Interfaces:
AlgorithmParameterSpec
public class AeadParameterSpec extends Object implements AlgorithmParameterSpec
A parameter specification for AEAD (Authenticated Encryption with Associated Data) cipher modes.

This class implements AlgorithmParameterSpec to provide a convenient way to specify the nonce/IV and authentication tag size for AEAD ciphers.

This is particularly useful as an alternative to GCMParameterSpec and provides compatibility across different JDK versions and AEAD cipher modes beyond GCM.

Usage Example


 // Create parameter spec with tag size and nonce
 byte[] nonce = new byte[12];
 AeadParameterSpec spec = new AeadParameterSpec(128, nonce);

 // Using with cipher
 Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("ChaCha20/Poly1305/NoPadding", "Botan");
 cipher.init(Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, key, spec);
 cipher.updateAAD(aad); // Optional: set AAD separately
 byte[] ciphertext = cipher.doFinal(plaintext);
Since:
0.1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • AeadParameterSpec

      public AeadParameterSpec(int tLen, byte[] iv)
      Constructs a parameter specification for AEAD cipher modes with a tag length and nonce.

      This constructor signature matches GCMParameterSpec for compatibility.

      Parameters:
      tLen - the authentication tag length in bits. The supported tag lengths depend on the cipher algorithm (e.g., 128 bits for ChaCha20-Poly1305).
      iv - the buffer containing the nonce (initialization vector). The required length depends on the cipher algorithm (e.g., 12 bytes for ChaCha20-Poly1305, 24 bytes for XChaCha20-Poly1305).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if src is null, or if tLen is negative or not a multiple of 8

    • AeadParameterSpec

      public AeadParameterSpec(int tLen, byte[] iv, int offset, int len)
      Constructs a parameter specification for AEAD cipher modes using a subset of a buffer as the nonce.

      This constructor signature matches GCMParameterSpec for compatibility.

      Parameters:
      tLen - the authentication tag length in bits. The supported tag lengths depend on the cipher algorithm (e.g., 128 bits for ChaCha20-Poly1305).
      iv - the buffer containing the nonce (initialization vector).
      offset - the offset in iv where the nonce data starts
      len - the number of nonce bytes. The required length depends on the cipher algorithm (e.g., 12 bytes for ChaCha20-Poly1305, 24 bytes for XChaCha20-Poly1305).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if iv is null, or if tLen is negative or not a multiple of 8, or if offset and len specify a range that exceeds the bounds of iv
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset or len is negative
